relevant_chunks.text: icon to open the Netwrix Technical Knowledge Center for the Recovery for Active Directory documentation User Profile – On clicking the profile icon, the following options are displayed: ◦◦ Manage – Click it to open the MFA page, where you can set up multi-factor authentication for your Recovery for Active Directory account.
On disabling MFA, the page displays a confirmation message and there is an option to enable it again.

Enable user – Enables the user in Active Directory Clear 'User must change password' flag upon restoration – Restored users do not receive an alert to change their password upon first login after a recovery.

Step 1 – To launch the Recovery Configuration Utility, double-click the Recovery_Config.ex e executable at the following location in the Recovery for Active Directory installation directory: ...Netwrix\Recovery for Active Directory\Recovery_Config.exe Step 2 – Update the account password for SQL Server Authentication in the Login and Password fields.
Account – Enter a user account or group [DOMAIN\ACCOUNT] that will be the default Recovery for Active Directory administrator.
